title: Fix missing Mission image under “Our Mission” section

requirements.text: Ensure the Mission section image loads correctly under the “Our Mission” heading on the Home page by verifying the static asset exists at the exact path referenced by `MISSION_IMAGE_PATH` and is served by the frontend build.
acceptanceCriteria: The file `frontend/public/assets/generated/img-20260210-wa0017-uploaded.dim_1536x307.jpg` exists in the repo and is included in the deployed frontend build output as a static asset.
Requesting `GET /assets/generated/img-20260210-wa0017-uploaded.dim_1536x307.jpg` returns HTTP 200 and the image bytes.
The image renders on the Home page Mission section without broken-image behavior.

requirements.text: Add resilient client-side error handling for the Mission section image element so that if the image fails to load, the UI shows a clear in-page fallback message (English) instead of a broken image.
acceptanceCriteria: If the Mission image fails to load (e.g., by temporarily changing `MISSION_IMAGE_PATH` to an invalid path), the Home page displays a visible fallback message in place of the image.
If the Mission image loads successfully, no fallback message is shown and the layout remains unchanged.

constraints: Do not modify, recompress, resize, convert, rename, or otherwise change the uploaded Mission image file bytes (`img-20260210-wa0017-uploaded.dim_1536x307.jpg`).
Keep using the centralized constant `MISSION_IMAGE_PATH` from `frontend/src/constants/missionAssets.ts` as the source of truth for the Mission image path.
Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Adding new images or changing the Mission section copy/layout beyond what is necessary to handle image-load failures.
Changing backend logic or storing the Mission image in the backend blob store.
